revised_title: Mercury Injection and Its Effects on a Dog's Body
tldr: Dr. Christoph Pitt dissects a dog that had mercury injected into its jugular. The mercury was found in the dog's abdomen and other body cavities. The glands were swollen, and there was a significant amount of serum. This case can be called a true hyarocephalos. The dog's behavior and possible effects of the mercury injection are discussed.
